bugs.title: CVE-2019-15142 mingw-djvulibre: djvulibre: heap-based buffer overflow in GStringRep::strdup in libdjvu/GString.cpp [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-15142 mingw-djvulibre: djvulibre: heap-based buffer overflow in GStringRep::strdup in libdjvu/GString.cpp [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-15142 djvulibre: heap-based buffer overflow in GStringRep::strdup in libdjvu/GString.cpp

long_desc.thetext:
In DjVuLibre 3.5.27, DjVmDir.cpp in the DJVU reader component allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service (application crash in GStringRep::strdup in libdjvu/GString.cpp caused by a heap-based buffer over-read) by crafting a DJVU file.

Reference:
https://sourceforge.net/p/djvu/bugs/296/

Upstream commit:
https://sourceforge.net/p/djvu/djvulibre-git/ci/970fb11a296b5bbdc5e8425851253d2c5913c45e/

Created djvulibre tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1767844]
Affects: epel-7 [bug 1767845]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1767842]


Created mingw-djvulibre tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1767843]

bugs.title: CVE-2019-15143 mingw-djvulibre: djvulibre: infinite loop in GBitmap::read_rle_raw related to libdjvu/DjVmDir.cpp and libdjvu/GBitmap.cpp [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-15143 mingw-djvulibre: djvulibre: infinite loop in GBitmap::read_rle_raw related to libdjvu/DjVmDir.cpp and libdjvu/GBitmap.cpp [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-15143 djvulibre: infinite loop in GBitmap::read_rle_raw related to libdjvu/DjVmDir.cpp and libdjvu/GBitmap.cpp

long_desc.thetext:
In DjVuLibre 3.5.27, the bitmap reader component allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service error (resource exhaustion caused by a GBitmap::read_rle_raw infinite loop) by crafting a corrupted image file, related to libdjvu/DjVmDir.cpp and libdjvu/GBitmap.cpp.

Reference:
https://sourceforge.net/p/djvu/bugs/297/

Upstream commit:
https://sourceforge.net/p/djvu/djvulibre-git/ci/b1f4e1b2187d9e5010cd01ceccf20b4a11ce723f/

Created djvulibre tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1767859]
Affects: epel-7 [bug 1767860]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1767857]

bugs.title: CVE-2019-15144 mingw-djvulibre: djvulibre: recursive call to GArrayTemplate<Run>::sort in GContainer.h leads to stack overflow [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-15144 mingw-djvulibre: djvulibre: recursive call to GArrayTemplate<Run>::sort in GContainer.h leads to stack overflow [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-15144 djvulibre: recursive call to GArrayTemplate<Run>::sort in GContainer.h leads to stack overflow

long_desc.thetext:
In DjVuLibre 3.5.27, the sorting functionality (aka GArrayTemplate<TYPE>::sort) allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service (application crash due to an Uncontrolled Recursion) by crafting a PBM image file that is mishandled in libdjvu/GContainer.h.

Reference:
https://sourceforge.net/p/djvu/bugs/299/

Upstream commit:
https://sourceforge.net/p/djvu/djvulibre-git/ci/e15d51510048927f172f1bf1f27ede65907d940d/

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1767868]

bugs.title: CVE-2019-15145 mingw-djvulibre: djvulibre: out-of-bounds read in JB2Dict::JB2Codec::get_direct_context in libdjvu/JB2Image.h [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-15145 mingw-djvulibre: djvulibre: out-of-bounds read in JB2Dict::JB2Codec::get_direct_context in libdjvu/JB2Image.h [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-15145 djvulibre: out-of-bounds read in JB2Dict::JB2Codec::get_direct_context in libdjvu/JB2Image.h

long_desc.thetext:
DjVuLibre 3.5.27 allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service attack (application crash via an out-of-bounds read) by crafting a corrupted JB2 image file that is mishandled in JB2Dict::JB2Codec::get_direct_context in libdjvu/JB2Image.h because of a missing zero-bytes check in libdjvu/GBitmap.h.

Reference:
https://sourceforge.net/p/djvu/bugs/298/

Upstream commit:
https://sourceforge.net/p/djvu/djvulibre-git/ci/9658b01431cd7ff6344d7787f855179e73fe81a7/

Created djvulibre tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1767923]
Affects: epel-7 [bug 1767924]

bugs.title: CVE-2019-18804 mingw-djvulibre: djvulibre: null pointer dereference in function DJVU::filter_fv in [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-18804 mingw-djvulibre: djvulibre: null pointer dereference in function DJVU::filter_fv in [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-18804 djvulibre: null pointer dereference in function DJVU::filter_fv in IW44EncodeCodec.cpp

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in DjVuLibre 3.5.27 has a NULL pointer dereference in the function DJVU::filter_fv at IW44EncodeCodec.cpp.

Reference:
https://github.com/TeamSeri0us/pocs/blob/master/djvulibre/DJVU__filter_fv%40IW44EncodeCodec.cpp_499-43___SEGV_UNKNOW.md
https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/11/msg00004.html
https://sourceforge.net/p/djvu/bugs/309/
